001package game;
002
003import javax.swing.*;
004import java.awt.*;
005import java.awt.event.*;
006import java.net.URL;
007//import java.awt.image.*;
008
009/**
010 * This class implements a simple graphical user interface with a 
011 * text entry area, a text output area and an optional image.
012 * 
013 * @author Michael Kolling
014 * @version 1.0 (Jan 2003) DB edited (2023) Christophe TARATIBU modified (2025)
015 */
016public class UserInterface implements ActionListener
017{
018    private GameEngine aEngine;
019    private JFrame     aMyFrame;
020    private JTextField aEntryField;
021    private JTextArea  aLog;
022    private JLabel     aImage;
023    private JButton   aQuitButton;
024    private JButton aGoWestButton;
025    private JButton aGoNorthButton;
026    private JButton aGoSouthButton;
027    private JButton aGoEastButton;
028
029    /**
030     * Construct a UserInterface. As a parameter, a Game Engine
031     * (an object processing and executing the game commands) is
032     * needed.
033     * @param pGameEngine  The GameEngine object implementing the game logic.
034     */
035    public UserInterface( final GameEngine pGameEngine )
036    {
037        this.aEngine = pGameEngine;
038        this.createGUI();
039    } // UserInterface(.)
040
041    /**
042     * Print out some text into the text area.
043     * @param pText Text to print
044     */
045    public void print( final String pText )
046    {
047        this.aLog.append( pText );
048        this.aLog.setCaretPosition( this.aLog.getDocument().getLength() );
049    } // print(.)
050
051    /**
052     * Print out some text into the text area, with a carriage return.
053     * @param pText Text to print
054     */
055    public void println( final String pText )
056    {
057        this.print( pText + "\n" );
058    } // println(.)
059
060    /**
061     * Show an image file in the interface.
062     * @param pImageName The name of the image file.
063     */
064    public void showImage( final String pImageName )
065    {
066        String vImagePath = "" + pImageName; // to change the directory
067        URL vImageURL = this.getClass().getClassLoader().getResource( vImagePath );
068        if ( vImageURL == null )
069       
070            System.out.println( "Image not found : " + vImagePath );
071        else {
072            //System.out.println("Image found : " + vImagePath );
073            ImageIcon vIcon = new ImageIcon( vImageURL );
074            Image vImage = vIcon.getImage();
075            Image vNewImage = vImage.getScaledInstance( 600, 400, Image.SCALE_SMOOTH);
076            vIcon = new ImageIcon( vNewImage );
077            this.aImage.setIcon( vIcon );
078            //this.aImage.res
079            this.aMyFrame.pack();
080        }
081    } // showImage(.)
082
083    /**
084     * Enable or disable input in the entry field.
085     * @param pOnOff true to enable, false to disable
086     */
087    public void enable( final boolean pOnOff )
088    {
089        this.aEntryField.setEditable( pOnOff ); // enable/disable
090        if ( pOnOff ) { // enable
091            this.aEntryField.getCaret().setBlinkRate( 500 ); // cursor blink
092            this.aEntryField.addActionListener( this ); // reacts to entry
093        }
094        else { // disable
095            this.aEntryField.getCaret().setBlinkRate( 0 ); // cursor won't blink
096            this.aEntryField.removeActionListener( this ); // won't react to entry
097        }
098    } // enable(.)
099
100    /**
101     * Set up graphical user interface.
102     */
103    private void createGUI()
104    {
105        this.aMyFrame = new JFrame( "The return of Yamata no Orochi" ); // change the title !
106        this.aEntryField = new JTextField( 34 );
107        this.aQuitButton = new JButton("Quit");
108        this.aGoNorthButton = new JButton("go north");
109        this.aGoSouthButton = new JButton("go south");
110        this.aGoEastButton = new JButton("go east");
111        this.aGoWestButton = new JButton("go west");
112        this.aLog = new JTextArea();
113        this.aLog.setEditable( false );
114        JScrollPane vListScroller = new JScrollPane( this.aLog );
115        vListScroller.setPreferredSize( new Dimension(200, 200) );
116        vListScroller.setMinimumSize( new Dimension(100,100) );
117
118        this.aImage = new JLabel();
119
120        JPanel vPanel = new JPanel();
121        vPanel.setLayout( new BorderLayout() ); // ==> only five places
122        vPanel.add( this.aImage, BorderLayout.NORTH );
123        vPanel.add( vListScroller, BorderLayout.CENTER );
124        vPanel.add( this.aEntryField, BorderLayout.SOUTH );
125
126        JPanel vSouthPanel = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
127        vSouthPanel.add(this.aEntryField,BorderLayout.CENTER);
128        vSouthPanel.add(this.aGoNorthButton,BorderLayout.NORTH);
129        vSouthPanel.add(this.aGoEastButton,BorderLayout.EAST);
130        vSouthPanel.add(this.aGoWestButton,BorderLayout.WEST);
131        vSouthPanel.add(this.aGoSouthButton,BorderLayout.SOUTH);
132        //vSouthPanel.add(this.aQuitButton,BorderLayout.SOUTH);
133        JPanel vSouthButtonsPanel = new JPanel(new GridLayout(2, 1, 0, 5));
134        vSouthButtonsPanel.add(this.aGoSouthButton);
135        vSouthButtonsPanel.add(this.aQuitButton);
136        vSouthPanel.add(vSouthButtonsPanel,BorderLayout.SOUTH);
137        vPanel.add(vSouthPanel,BorderLayout.SOUTH);
138        this.aMyFrame.getContentPane().add( vPanel, BorderLayout.CENTER );
139        //this.aMyFrame.getContentPane().add( this.aQuitButton, BorderLayout.SOUTH );
140
141        // add some event listeners to some components
142        this.aEntryField.addActionListener( this );
143        this.aQuitButton.addActionListener(this);
144        this.aGoNorthButton.addActionListener(this);
145        this.aGoSouthButton.addActionListener(this);
146        this.aGoEastButton.addActionListener(this);
147        this.aGoWestButton.addActionListener(this);
148
149        // to end program when window is closed
150        this.aMyFrame.addWindowListener(
151            new WindowAdapter() { // anonymous class
152                @Override public void windowClosing(final WindowEvent pE)
153                {
154                    System.exit(0);
155                }
156        } );
157
158        this.aMyFrame.pack();
159        this.aMyFrame.setVisible( true );
160        this.aEntryField.requestFocus();
161    } // createGUI()
162
163    /**
164     * Actionlistener interface for entry textfield.
165     */
166    @Override public void actionPerformed( final ActionEvent pE ) 
167    {
168        // no need to check the type of action at the moment
169        // because there is only one possible action (text input) :
170        if(pE.getSource() == this.aQuitButton){
171            //this.aEngine.endGame();
172            this.processCommand("quit");
173            Timer vTimer = new Timer(1000, ev -> System.exit(0));
174            vTimer.setRepeats(false);
175            vTimer.start();
176        } else if(pE.getSource() == this.aGoNorthButton){
177            this.processCommand("go north");
178        } else if(pE.getSource() == this.aGoSouthButton){
179            this.processCommand("go south");
180        }  else if(pE.getSource() == this.aGoWestButton){
181            this.processCommand("go west");
182        }  else if(pE.getSource() == this.aGoEastButton){
183            this.processCommand("go east");
184        } else {
185            this.processCommand(null);
186        }
187         // never suppress this line
188    } // actionPerformed(.)
189
190    /**
191     * A command has been entered in the entry field.  
192     * Read the command and do whatever is necessary to process it.
193     * @param pInput The input command string.
194     */
195    private void processCommand(final String pInput)
196    {
197        if(pInput == null){
198            String vInputKb = this.aEntryField.getText();
199            this.aEntryField.setText( "" );
200            this.aEngine.interpretCommand( vInputKb );
201        } else {
202            this.aEntryField.setText( "" );
203            this.aEngine.interpretCommand(pInput);
204        }
205        
206    } // processCommand()
207} // UserInterface 
208
